meanings.definition: The quality or state of being jetty.
meanings.sent1: The jettiness of the dock made it easy to walk along.
meanings.sent2: I admired the jettiness of the pier as it stretched out into the ocean.
meanings.sent3: The jettiness of the jetty made it look like a long, skinny bridge.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence had a jettiness that propelled her forward in life.
meanings.sent5: The jettiness of the cliff edge was both thrilling and scary.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of projecting or extending outward.
meanings.sent1: The jettiness of the tree branches reached towards the sky.
meanings.sent2: The building's jettiness created a unique architectural design.
meanings.sent3: The jettiness of the umbrella made it stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent4: His ideas had a jettiness that pushed the boundaries of innovation.
meanings.sent5: The jettiness of the mountain peak was visible from miles away.
